intro: Leucopogon neurophyllus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf heath, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heaths and heathers, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in open forest or heathland habitats. Its flowers are usually pink or white, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the spring and summer seasons. Leucopogon neurophyllus is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to tolerate salty air and well-drained soils.
